ports.name: AudioBuffer 0
ports.text: Connect this to an Ops.WebAudio.AudioBuffer op, which holds the audio-sample you want to use

ports.name: Start Buffer
ports.text: Starts the buffer at index `Buffer Index` at time `Time`, also uses `Offset` `Duration`, `Pitch`, `Gain`

ports.name: Buffer Index
ports.text: The number of the buffer to start / stop

ports.name: Time
ports.text: When to start / stop a buffer â€“ `+0` = *now*, `+3` = *in three seconds*

ports.name: Fade In Time
ports.text: How long it takes until the sample is at full volume

ports.name: Offset
ports.text: The offset into the buffer to play from, e.g. `0.1` skips the first 0.1 seconds

ports.name: Duration
ports.text: How long to play the buffer for, can be left empty

ports.name: Pitch
ports.text: The interval to repitch the buffer, `-1` = *one semitone down*, `1` = *one semitones up*, `12` = *one octave up*

ports.name: Gain
ports.text: The gain to play the sample at, `1` = *default*

ports.name: Start Buffer (Loop)
ports.text: Same as `Start Buffer` but the playback will be looped. Starts the buffer at index `Buffer Index` at time `Time`, also uses `Offset` `Duration`, `Pitch`, `Gain`. Additionally you can specify `Loop Start` and `Loop End`

ports.name: Loop Start Time
ports.text: When to start the loop, can be left empty

ports.name: Loop End Time
ports.text: When to end the loop, can be left empty

ports.name: Stop Buffer
ports.text: Stops the buffer at index `Buffer Index` at time `Time`. If this buffer is being played multiple times, only the first one will be stopped.

ports.name: Stop All Buffers
ports.text: Stops all buffers at time `Time`, will not use `Fade Out Time`

ports.name: Fade Out Time
ports.text: How long it takes until the buffer is fully stopped when `Stop Buffer` was triggered

ports.name: Volume
ports.text: The volume of the `MultiPlayer` in dB

ports.name: Mute
ports.text: Mutes the whole player

ports.name: Audio Out
ports.text: The audio out
